comments:
After searching through a dozen reports on this I always find report on mismatching 32/64 VM/Eclispe but in my case it is pure 64 system.

I get permission denied when trying to launch eclipse executable and launching startup.jar manually don't get me much further both with 64 bit jdk 1.5 and 1.6.

The system is an Ubuntu 6.10 (edgy) AMD64 and the PC is an Intel Core Duo 2.

Tried to gather as much information as my limited knowledge allowed me.

Regards.

Created an attachment (id=56142)
Launching startup.jar with strace, java 1.5

Created an attachment (id=56143)
Launching startup.jar with strace, java 1.6

Ouch, that's a stupid one !

My ext3 home partition was mounted with user attribute but without the exec attribute. Adding the exec attribute to the /etc/fstab solved the problem as ./script won't work on a non executable filesystem.

Closing as INVALID sorry about the burden.
